Text.Value: More than stupid - moronic. You endangered everyone.
I'll send your head back to your mistress, you wretched scum.

EditorData.NodeContext: serious, determined - combat about to start

Text.Value: Thank you - the redcap proved that I'm no match for a hag. Much to my shame.
Tell me and I'll kill Ethel - I promise.
Have what?
Leave.
Never in my wildest dreams could I have bested the hag - thank you, my friend, for doing the impossible.
Any idea how to remove the hex?
What did you do to piss of a hag?
You're here! Mayrina was looking for you - she says it's urgent.
You protected Mayrina until now - that's worth something.
Must be some book.
I'm an imbecile - the doll showed up days after the dragonborn joined us. Why didn't I see it?
Tell me - maybe I can help.
So get out there and kill her. Don't sit here like cowards.
I need info - where have you seen the doll?
It's in a safe in the back - within lies everything I know about hags. Use that knowledge to kill Ethel, and free this world of her evil - I beg of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

Text.Value: This attack is proof. Auntie Ethel knows we've discovered her darkest secret, a way to send her to death's cold embrace - for all eternity.
The city is still under threat, and the future is uncertain - but this is a victory for all that is good and kind.
Leave.
The doll! Find the doll!
I won't be killing Ethel. In fact, I've made a deal with her.
You are kind, but I serve Helm - and failing to keep this hex from Mayrina is unforgivable in both his eyes and mine.

EditorData.NodeContext: small smile at the player's kindness. but in her mind, everything is still  her fault

Text.Value: Everywhere - inside boxes, under chairs. It could be anywhere.
Tell me what it is, and I'll deal with the hag - don't worry.
That means Ethel knows I'm here - and that I have it. Helm protect me - I'm dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: hint of fear as this dawns on her, building up to the last line

Text.Value: Hag, and their agents, are talented liars.
I won't make the same mistake again - I swear it.
Yes - finally.
Kill Ethel before she seeks vengeance for her fallen redcap. Save us - I beg of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

Text.Value: My only regret is that Mayrina did not live to see this. But she want me to set aside my sorrow - and would also yell at me for 'ruining the mood'.
I'm glad you're here. I clearly lack the power to keep the hag, and her hexes, away from Mayrina.
Ethel's darkest secret - a way to burn that witch for good. No more tricks, no more comebacks.
How fares Mayrina?
This is all my fault. Mayrina was hexed mere days after the dragonborn joined us. Why didn't I see it?
This is not the time.
I can't. If the dragonborn has shown me anything, it's that I'm not ready to face a hag - much to my shame.
You carry Helm's strength and assurance - He sent you to me, I know it.
Should you ever have need of a cleric of Helm, I shall be there - you have my word.
Join me - I'll need all the help I can get.
Helm is known as the Vigiliant One for good reason - while I could not see the hag, I could sense her. Now I feel roses where once there were thorns.
You endangered everyone.
Now is not the time for idle chatter - we need to find the doll!
There's so much blood. Mayrina! Check on Mayrina upstairs!

EditorData.NodeContext: shock at the dead redcap, trying to gain conftrol of the situation. Directing the player upstairs.

Text.Value: A doll was nearly our undoing - we have no chance against her, as much as it pains me to admit it.
I am not getting mixed up in this.
Leave.
You're lucky I was here to save your asses.
I was researching hags - and came upon their darkest secret.
That's no excuse - I know what they're like, yet still I welcomed the dragonborn with open arms.

EditorData.NodeContext: angry with herself - wishes she was 'better'

Text.Value: You should leave while you still can.
Wait! My research has painted a target on my back - and the redcap proved I am no match for a hag.
Just leave the building.
I'm an imbecile - Mayrina was hexed mere days after the dragonborn appeared.
The hag is dead, isn't she?
This is your problem, not mine.
There's a safe in the back - within is everything I know about hags and their abominations.
None. The magic originates from a hag's twisted lair - of that I am sure. But as to its cure, Helm has not revealed it to me.
Probably - you are quite useless.
There's a safe in the back with my life's work. I cannot bear to destroy it, but so long as it exists, I will be hunted. Take it - I beg of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

Text.Value: Blast it all - this is because of the book. I brought this on us all.
The city feels different - like evil's embrace has lessened its vice.
How did you know?
The hag could be anywhere in the city - find and kill her. I beg of you.
I fell for a hag's lies once, and in my arrogance was sure it would never happen again.
A doll? Hm. I saw a curious looking toy in some boxes upstairs, but I figured it the remnants of the previous tenants.
How?
I discovered Ethel's darkest secret - a way to burn that witch for good. No more tricks, no more comebacks.
When next I pray, you shall be the first name on my lips. Thank you.
Yes. I am... painfully aware. But some good has come of this.
Mayrina was right about you. Thank you - for saving her when I couldn't.

EditorData.NodeContext: sincere but also continuing to beat herself up for not being 'good enough'

Text.Value: Because to a hag, we are but lambs to her slaughter. We are mere toys - to be used and broken.
I spent a lifetime researching these vile creatures - but to my shame I'm no match for Ethel.
Have you seen a doll around here?
You must stop the hag, or she'll never stop tormenting us. Please.

EditorData.NodeContext: hpleading - hates how powerless she feels

Text.Value: I know Mayrina is hexed, but why a sheep?
I won't let that happen, I promise.
We tried - the wretched thing followed us. We have no choice - we must find and destroy it. Before it consumes us all.
Damn that hag - damn her to the Nine Hells.

EditorData.NodeContext: dissapointed in herself that she 'let' this happen

Text.Value: No, it cannot die with me! I discovered Ethel's darkest secret - a way to burn that witch for good. No more tricks, no more comebacks.
I was lost when Mayrina and I first met. Yet her courage reminded me of who I am - Helm's shield. I will not turn my back on her.

EditorData.NodeContext: fiercely determined to help her friend

Text.Value: Hag, and their agents, are liars and cheats by nature.
Leave.
There's a safe in the back - within is years worth of research. Kill her before she sends more of her monsters - I beg of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

Text.Value: He mentioned a book - mean anything to you?
Forgive me for raising a hand against you. The dragonborn worked hard to stoke our paranoia - yet the fiend was working for the hag this whole time.

EditorData.NodeContext: horrified that she attacked the player and that she missed the truth about the dragonborn

Text.Value: A way to burn their bones to ash - and ensure they never return. No tricks, no come-backs - only the cold permanence of death.
And now she's dead. Why didn't I see it? Why didn't I stop him? Damn it - damn it all!
Jatlo took off like the fiends of the Nine Hells were on his tail...

EditorData.logicalname: Doll Destroyed - No Jatlo Combat Yet

Text.Value: Explain it to me.

Synopsis:
Default dialogue for Adrielle, one of the hag support group players can meet in the Lower city. The hag support group is made up of people who have survived an encouter with a hag, and who have banded together to try to research hags, but also to be there for one another. However, one of their group (the dragonborn), is secretly a redcap and is toying with their minds. The redcap has also, if Mayrina is present, hexed her and turned her into a sheep. If Mayrina isn't present, the redcap has enchanted a doll that is terrifying the group.
This dialogue covers a number of states such as 1) Mayrina is present and has been hexed 2) player cured her 3) player has saved Adrielle and the others from a redcap 4) the hag is dead and Adrielle rewards them (if no other npc is present) 5) if mayrina isn't present, a doll is terrorising them and she's trying to find it
